FuncDef:
The lacp mixed-rate link enable command enables interfaces operating at different rates to forward packets after the interfaces are added to an Eth-Trunk interface in static LACP mode.
The undo lacp mixed-rate link enable command disables interfaces operating at different rates from forwarding packets after the interfaces join an Eth-Trunk interface in static LACP mode.
By default, after interfaces operating at different rates are added to an Eth-Trunk interface in static LACP mode, traffic is forwarded at one of the rates.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, after interfaces operating at different rates are added to an Eth-Trunk interface in static LACP mode, traffic is forwarded at only one of the rates through the corresponding interfaces. This operation cannot implement load balancing on the Eth-Trunk interface.
To implement load balancing, run the lacp mixed-rate link enable command to enable the Eth-Trunk interface's member interfaces operating at different rates to share packets.
Prerequisites
The Eth-Trunk interface has been configured to work in static LACP mode using the mode lacp-static command in the Eth-Trunk interface view.
The rate of the interface added to the Eth-Trunk interface is not limited. For example, 10G and 100G interfaces can be added to the same Eth-Trunk interface. The maximum forwarding rate of an Eth-Trunk interface is the sum of rates of the Eth-Trunk interface's member interfaces.
Follow-up Procedure
Set the distribute-weight of the member interface with different rates. By default, the weight of an Eth-Trunk member interface is 1.
